pullRequest.title: Wip/6.0 Fix HashMap constructor with expected size usage error
pullRequest.bodyText:
There are quite some coding statements with incorrect usage of new HashMap<>(n) in our codebase. When we aim to build a map with expected size, we should use another util class in our code base (i.e. CollectionHelper.mapOfSize( n )). Using new HashMap<>(n) takes no consideration of load factor  and we often end up with rehashing unless there are many hashing conflicts.
Also enrich CollectionHelperby providing a new setOfSize() method and fixed a bug in concurrentMap() util method (thus making it not useful any more).

commit.message: fix HashMap constructor with expected size usage error

afterCommit.message: fix HashMap constructor with expected size usage error

nodes.bodyText: There is a bug in old implementation. Different than HashMap or HashSet, ConcurrentHashMap will perform sizing computation internally so we don't need to compute on top of that.
No need to use the util method in CollectionHelper for ConcurrentHashMap constructor is enough for it will compute the size internally.
